com.midlocanics.frc.gongaware

Class AbstactComponentRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.microedition.midlet.MIDlet
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase
        • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot
          • com.midlocanics.frc.gongaware.AbstactComponentRobot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Robot

    public abstract class AbstactComponentRobot
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot
    A basic framework for a robot based on RobotComponents. Will run each component for all of tele-op. Autonomous must be defined, but the component system makes this much easier with proper component definitions.
    Author:
    RossG

    • Method Detail

      • robotInit

        public abstract void robotInit()
        Initializes the basic controllers and components. Should call intializeComponents() after finishing.
        Overrides:
        robotInit in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot

      • initializeComponents

        protected abstract void initializeComponents()
        Initializes all the individual components. Assume the arrays needed have already been defined, but all parts should be initialized here too.

      • autonomous

        public abstract void autonomous()
        Description copied from class: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot
        Autonomous should go here. Users should add autonomous code to this method that should run while the field is in the autonomous period. Called repeatedly while the robot is in the autonomous state.
        Overrides:
        autonomous in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets anything that needs to be reset before being run.

      • operatorControl

        public void operatorControl()
        Updates the controllers and then checks and runs each component. Runs for as long as the operator has control.
        Overrides:
        operatorControl in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SimpleRobot

      • pause

        public static void pause(long milliTime)
        Provides a convenient pause method for autonomous. SHOULD ONLY BE USED FOR AUTONOMOUS! Use in any component could cause other component to become unresponsive.
        Parameters:
        milliTime - The amount of time to pause.

      • pause

        public static void pause(double time)
        Same as the other pause but can use double for time. equivalent to calling pause((long)(time*1000))
        Parameters:
        time - amount of time to pause
